name: Hyksos Subjects to Empire Builders: Cultural and Political History of Ancient Egypt II
description: Exploration of the primary archaeological, architectural, and inscriptional sources, questioning interpretations and analyzing how Egypt confronted foreign domination and developed into a major empire in the New Kingdom under Thutmose III, Hatshepsut, Akhenaten, and Ramesses II, then fragmented politically in the Third Intermediate Period and ultimately became a colony itself.
prerequisites: 5 FCE in any field or 1 FCE in NMC
